image.altText: A close up historic shot of a man wearing aviator sunglasses.

props.synopsis: The ABC understands convicted child murderer Bevan Spencer von Einem has been taken to the Yatala infirmary in Adelaide where he only has a short time to live.

title.children: Notorious child killer Bevan von Einem on brink of death in jail

image.altText: Two people stand in a smoke-filled paddock with their arms around each other.

props.synopsis: Ten years after the Pinery bushfire tore through an area roughly the size of Greater Adelaide, those who were there reflect on how it changed their lives.

title.children: Community now better prepared 10 years on from deadly Pinery bushfire

image.altText: A young man in a check shirt in front of a mural.

props.synopsis: Youth homelessness support services say the pandemic and an associated surge in real estate prices have made it even harder to secure accommodation.

title.children: Rental market making it harder to help young people 'out of crisis homelessness'

image.altText: Photo of Gus

props.synopsis: In their effort to find missing four-year-old Gus, police have vowed "explore every avenue" — which now includes several mine shafts around the property where he disappeared.

title.children: Gus search to begin as police vow to 'explore every avenue'

image.altText: A CFS firefighter in firefighting helmet and clothing.

props.synopsis: Emergency authorities are paying tribute to Country Fire Service firefighter Peter Curtis, who died in the line of duty at a conservation park on South Australia's Eyre Peninsula.

title.children: 'Much-loved' firefighter dies at scene of Eyre Peninsula blaze

image.altText: A man on a green tractor clearing downed trees.

props.synopsis: Port Pirie residents and businesses are picking up the pieces after record-breaking thunderstorms hit town over the weekend.

title.children: Clean-up underway following destructive thunderstorms in Port Pirie

image.altText: Golden wheat in the sunshine.

props.synopsis: ElectraNet are shifting their focus east, after farmers voiced concerns about renewable energy line Northern Transmission Project running through prime cropping country.

title.children: ElectraNet to change power corridor plan after farmers voice concerns

image.altText: An overhead view of an outback spring.

props.synopsis: The Great Artesian Basin covers a fifth of Australia and contains water that has been there for millions of years. Now, decades of extraction are taking their toll and traditional owners are fighting a mining giant for compensation.

title.children: Water is under pressure in the Great Artesian Basin

image.altText: Two people stand in a smoke-filled paddock with their arms around each other.

props.synopsis: Ten years after the Pinery bushfire tore through an area roughly the size of Greater Adelaide, those who were there reflect on how it changed their lives.

title.children: Community now better prepared 10 years on from deadly Pinery bushfire

image.altText: A woman in a white shirt sitting in a wheelchair on a ramp at the back of a vehicle next to a man in a checked shirt

props.synopsis: When there are so few taxis in your regional city that you can actually use, it can be detrimental to your independence when it no longer shows up.

title.children: City's only wheelchair taxi missing in action leaving customers in limbo

image.altText: A wide shot of Mount Gambier's Blue Lake.

props.synopsis: Most lakes are kind of blue, but this lake in South Australia stands out for its super-bright colour that attracts tourists from around the country. But just why it is so blue and why it changes colour during the year are not well known.

title.children: Why is Mount Gambier's Blue Lake so blue?

image.altText: Arabana ranger Zaaheer McKenzie at the site of a spring.

props.synopsis: Environmentalists are calling for mining giant BHP to end its water extraction from the Great Artesian Basin when a major desalination plant is built in South Australia's north.

title.children: Calls for BHP to end water extraction before culturally significant springs are lost

image.altText: Photo of Gus

props.synopsis: SA Police says it will restart its search for four-year-old Gus, who went missing in the state's Mid North almost two months ago.

title.children: SA Police to restart search for 4yo Gus, six mine shafts to be searched

image.altText: A man hold up a light to a large hole in the ceiling, debris all over the kitchen counter and floor

props.synopsis: Thousands of residents were faced with outages in the South Australian town of Port Pirie after a severe thunderstorm and hail destroyed roofs as well as bringing down trees and powerlines.

title.children: SA town experiences "most significant storm event" on record

image.altText: A satellite image of Australia with a large mass of cloud at the top.

props.synopsis: Cyclone Fina is tracking inland in WA's far north as a category one system.

title.children: Cyclone Fina now category one as it tracks inland

image.altText: A screen with YouTube on it. A person hands appear, blurred, near the screen. The background is bright pink and blue.

props.synopsis: BTN High tests what YouTube content will be viewable without an account ahead of next month's social media ban, as an academic says the restrictions are unlikely to change what young people are watching.

title.children: Will teens without accounts be safe on YouTube under social media ban?

image.altText: Valentino Yuel dribbles the ball in an Asian Champions League game

props.synopsis: Since becoming a professional, Valentino Yuel has played in Australia's A-League, as well as for clubs in Türkiye, Iran, Qatar, Uzbekistan, Libya and now Hong Kong.

title.children: Footballer's 'fascination' for different cultures sees him globetrotting with clubs

image.altText: The SA flag flies above South Australia's Parliament House.

props.synopsis: Four and a half years after a landmark review into sexual harassment, South Australia's Parliament has been accused of moving at a "glacial pace" on workplace reforms, with a new report revealing staff concerns about power imbalances and a "deeply ingrained culture of favouritism".

title.children: Favouritism, fear and double standards: SA Parliament's culture under fire

image.altText: A man without a shirt wearing a blue hat poses for a photo by a lake with kids.

props.synopsis: Olympic gold medal-winning swimmer Kyle Chalmers is inspiring young and aspiring athletes, and speaking about the importance of mental health.

title.children: Olympic gold medalist swaps coast for the outback on mental health tour

image.altText: Pauline Hanson wearing a burka walks out of the Senate with members of One Nation.

props.synopsis: The rare break in proceedings came after One Nation's Pauline Hanson strode into the chamber wearing a burka and then refused to leave after being slapped with a sanction.

title.children: Senate shut down for 1.5 hours after Pauline Hanson's burka stunt

props.synopsis: New data shows some patients with serious mental health conditions have been waiting more than 23 hours for a bed in emergency departments.

title.children: 'These are real humans': More mental health patients ending up in EDs

image.altText: An older man with thinning grey hair wears a dark suit as he stands and speaks.

props.synopsis: Macarthur MP Mike Freelander believes the multi-partisan support for restricting gambling advertising means the reforms will "get there" eventually.

title.children: Gambling ad ban would pass parliament with conscience vote, Labor MP says

image.altText: Donald Trump places a hand on his chest.

props.synopsis: Trump cares little for alliances. So his presidency could well offer a priceless gift to Australia: a rare moment when national self-interest can eclipse sentiment.

title.children: Trump putting America first could be a priceless gift to Australia

image.altText: Donald Trump and Xi Jinping talk as they leave after a bilateral meeting in South Korea

props.synopsis: Chinese state media reported some of what was discussed in the phone call that took place on Monday, local time.

title.children: Taiwan's 'return to China' key to international order, Xi tells Trump

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenskyy, wearing black, speaks in front of a Ukrainian flag

props.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warns his country's borders "cannot be changed by force", highlighting a key sticking point in negotiations with the US over a potential peace deal with Russia.

title.children: Zelenskyy warns Ukraine's borders 'cannot be changed by force'

image.altText: Marilyn Warren, who has short brown hair, poses for a photo wearing a cream blazer

props.synopsis: Marilyn Warren made history when she was appointed chief justice of the Supreme Court of Victoria, though she has never thought of herself as a trailblazer.

title.children: She was a trailblazer for women in law. Her gender was, at times, a burden

image.altText: A person sits in a cell, as seen through a heavy door with a barred viewing window in it.

props.synopsis: The family of a dying man asked for his records from Tasmania's only youth detention centre, Ashley. They were told it could take eight months — time he does not have.

title.children: Terminally ill man in race against time to access records of child imprisonment

image.altText: A girl holds on to a cardboard box labelled "GHF" while sitting on a cart

props.synopsis: More than 800 Palestinians died in the vicinity of Gaza Humanitarian Foundation aid sites after it took over the distribution of all supplies in the strip in May.

title.children: Controversial Israel and US-backed Gaza aid organisation closes

image.altText: Two bystanders look on at helicopter crash scene.

props.synopsis: First responders have recounted the "absolute chaos" after two Sea World helicopters crashed in 2023, killing four people.

title.children: Inquest hears of 'absolute chaos' after deadly Sea World helicopter crash

image.altText: A still image from a TV show depicts a man with a mullet disarming a bomb with one second remaining until detonation.

props.synopsis: Every question has only two options, one is right and the other is wrong. You have an even chance of guessing correctly each time.

title.children: Try our new 50-50 quiz: Every question is an even chance

image.altText: Words reading "Artificial intelligence AI", miniature of robot and toy hand are pictured

props.synopsis: 'AI slop' refers to low-quality content created by generative AI which often contains errors and is not requested by the user, according to Macquarie.

title.children: Macquarie Dictionary names 'AI slop' as word of the year 2025

image.altText: Jamaican musician Jimmy Cliff performs on stage.

props.synopsis: Cliff was known for singles You Can Get It If You Really Want It and Many Rivers To Cross, as well as for his cover of Johnny Nash's I Can See Clearly Now.

title.children: Jimmy Cliff,  legendary Jamaican singer and reggae music pioneer, dies at 81

image.altText: A man wearing a suit speaks to someone out of frame against a black background

props.synopsis: India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi is one of many to pay tribute to the icon of Indian cinema.

title.children: Bollywood superstar Dharmendra dies aged 89

image.altText: a person sits at a desk looking at the new Bureau of Meteorology website

props.synopsis: The Bureau of the Meteorology's new chief executive has blamed a "miscommunication" for the furore that has erupted over a costly and controversial website redesign.

title.children: BOM boss reveals $96.5m website rebuild approved by Turnbull government

image.altText: A profile photo of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro.

props.synopsis: The designation — which is unusual, as experts say it isn't a real organisation — is the latest measure in the Trump administration's escalating campaign to combat drug trafficking into the US.

title.children: US labels Venezuela's Cartel de los Soles a terror organisation
